column2: Food & Wine's Top 10 Restaurant Dishes of 2011
column3: did not live up to the hype. The first time I went and ordered it
column4: I didn't even get it.. Just the bill for it.. Second visit
column5: it came out overcooked and tough. Like Matt said
column6: you get the unwelcoming 'this is burnt' smell when you open the jar. It had four different cuts of duck (w/different textures)
column7: but there really was only one flavor. Its $30
column8: so I do what anyone else would do
column9: and I send it back. Waiter apologizes and bring out a fresh one.. Not as tough
column10: still rather bland.. Maybe I'm spoiled from years of eating Beijing Duck??
